conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a cutaway/isometric interior with extruded walls (height + thickness), visible floor plane, and multiple wall faces (top/side) shown from an elevated angle.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D extrusion with clear wall height/thickness and readable room volumes; clean cutaway. Minor simplification at some wall junctions/edges and slightly stylized proportions.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room arrangement matches: bedroom on left, living/dining central, kitchen to the right, toilet near upper middle. Balcony/entry zone present but some secondary spaces (utility/foyer subdivision) appear simplified or not as distinctly partitioned as in 2D; some openings placement/proportions are approximate.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture and fixtures present (bed/wardrobe, sofa, dining table, kitchen cabinets, toilet). Some elements simplified; not all 2D-indicated built-ins/utility details are represented.

visual_clarity.notes: Readable walls/floors and openings with clean rendering and good visibility. Materials are consistent and background is unobtrusive; minor ambiguity in a few partitions/openings due to simplification.

detected_errors.description: Utility/foyer partitioning from the 2D plan is simplified in the 3D (secondary space boundaries not as clearly preserved).
Some door/window openings appear approximate in size/placement compared with the 2D plan (not all openings are clearly mapped 1:1).
Furniture/fixtures are simplified blocks; some built-in/details shown in 2D are not fully modeled.

summary: A true cutaway 3D conversion with strong overall layout fidelity, with minor-to-moderate simplification of secondary partitions and some openings/details.
